DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to investigate whether anodal tDCS over the left M1 leads to a decrease of GABA concentration and alterations of functional brain connectivity in younger people, compared to sham tDCS.
DOC.brief_title: tDCS Effects on GABA Concentration and Brain Functional Connectivity in Young Adults
DOC.criteria: unobtrusive neuropsychological screening age: young adults: 1830 years Mild cognitive impairment (MCI) or other neurological diseases History of severe alcoholism or use of drugs Severe psychiatric disorders such as depression, psychosis (if not in remission) and severe untreated medical problems Contraindication for MRI (claustrophobia, metallic implants, ferromagnetic metals in the body, disorders of thermoregulation, pregnant women)
